page.title: 01SUMMARY OF CARRICKFERGUS.
page.content: The name Carrickfergus is derived from the legendary figure of Fergus, who was either a King of Scotland or an Irish chieftain around 320B.C. Once the capital of Ulster, it is situated 10miles along the Belfast Lough shore and has a strikingly beautiful hinterland of farmland, forest and reservoirs. In the early l95O's its growth developed with the man_made fibre industry but with the closure of I.C.I.and Courtaulds in l98l more attention has swung to the development of the harbour area. The Courtaulds factory has become an Industrial Estate covering a wide range of individual small firms. Our survey area stretches West from the Woodburn river (which means MAD River) and follows its course south to the old Courtaulds complex on the Lough shore. The western boundary is Knockagh.
